31643 Mk 93037 24th Sunday in Ordinary Time September 16 2018 Year Next weekend I will be gone on pilgrimage to Rome I am traveling with sev eral priests of our diocese to attend the ordination of seminarian Spenser St Louis to the order of the diaconate at St Peters Basilica Spenser a Fort Waynenative has spent the past three years in seminary at the North Ameri can College in Rome and will be one of the three men ordained as a priest of our diocese next June in Fort Wayne at the Cathedral of the Immaculate Con ception Fr Louis Fowoyo a priest in residence at the Cathedral will be here during my absence to assist with our liturgies and to attend to any emergen cies that may arise If you have any special intentions that you would like me to keep in prayer during this pilgrimage please email your intentions to me at frdavidvioligmail.com Though our Lord offered hope to His chosen people last week in our first reading they have continued to complain against and doubt Him In re sponse the author of our first reading Isaiah 5059 now speaks as the ser vant of the Lord and describes the long awaited Messiah The prophet reas sures Israel of Gods fidelity to His people even though they themselves have been found unfaithful time and time again The Messiah who is to come to save Israel exemplifies obedience to God an obedience that Israel itself is called to Like Israel suffering exile the Servant of the Lord will suffer many great injustices and hardships Unlike Israel however the Servant of the Lord will not falter in following after the Lord Instead He will remain faithful as the Lord is Himself always faithful The treatment that the Servant of the Lord faces in Isaiah is one that mirrors the treatment that Jesus will face on the Cross The Sanhedrin even reference this same passage of Isaiah as they strike and hurl abuse at our Lord Matthew 266768 Parallels such as this is a form of Scripture reading called typology Typology is when an Old Testament personevent foreshadows a greater personevent in the New Testament The former is a type of the lat ter In this way the Servant of the Lord in Isaiah is a foreshadowing or type of Jesus The prophet reveals something of the Messiah and how He is to be treat that we see fulfilled in the Gospels All things especially the Old Testa ment prophecies point us always to Jesus Christ Pointing us towards Jesus we must now turn to our Gospel reading for today Mark 82735 Our Lord recognizes that the people seeking Him out do not yet fully understand that He is the Messiah For this reason He asks His disciples this most important question Who do you say that I am Simon Peter our first Pope boldly answers for the group acknowledging Jesus as the Christ Jesus proceeds to describe the suffering He will endure as the Servant of the Lord and challenges those who wish to follow Him to be pre pared to follow Him in all things including carrying the Cross To be a disci ple one who follows after Jesus is no easy task Instead it is one that must challenge each of us throughout our entire lives In this way the Gospel mes sage will be preached not only in our words but through the testimony of our very lives As St James says in our second reading James 21418 we dem onstrate our faith in Jesus to the world from our works Our faith compels us to act and our actions testify loudly to our faith How will we today show that we like St Peter and the Apostles recognize Jesus as the Christ Will lives our very actions in this day reflect the faith we hold in our hearts In Christ Fr David WEEKEND DogsBunsCondimentsLemonade Water Provided by the Church or if you prefer Bring Your Own Adult Beverage MARCH FOR LIFE AT THE STREET FAIR The March For Life in the Bluffton Street Fair Industrial Parade will be Thursday September 20 at 600PM We will start lining up at 530PMon Main St past Cherry St Just look for the Navy Blue Shirts and the ProLife signs We ask that every one try to wear navy blue shirts or jackets if possible however no one will be turned away who wants to march We will be passing out ProLife bracelets and Life Saver Candies to the crowds Please take this opportunity to stand up for the vulnerable unborn handicapped elderly who cannot speak up for themselves JUICE MILK AND DONUTS Sunday September 16 we will have donuts after the 730 and 10:00am Masses served by our St Joseph Youth Group OCTOBER IS RESPECT LIFE MONTH We cannot accept or buy into a throwaway culture that devalues human life and dignity in which inno cent unborn children are allowed to be destroyed and thrown away in which poor refugees are not welcomed and in which the frail elderly and the week are offered not care and accompaniment but in the name of a false compassion assistance in suicide
